perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Remarketing Agents will enter into a Pricing Agreement, to be dated the Remarketing Date (as defined below) (the "Pricing Agreement"), which will set forth, inter alia, the final terms of the Remarketed Securities (as defined below) and the Remarketing Fee (as defined below).
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Remarketing Agents will enter into a Pricing Agreement, to be dated the Remarketing Date (as defined below) (the "Fee Agreement"), which will set forth, inter alia, the final terms of the Remarketed Securities (as defined below) and the Remarketing Fee (as defined below).
perturbation.explanation: Changed "Pricing Agreement" to "Fee Agreement." This is a key term used throughout the document, and this change creates confusion and contradiction later on where the original "Pricing Agreement" term is used. This contradicts the fact that the 'Pricing Agreement' is well defined, and now there is no mention of this name, within the text.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The statements set forth in each of the Disclosure Package and the Final Prospectus under the captions "Description of Debt Securities" and "Description of Remarketed Series E Debentures" insofar as they purport to constitute a summary of the terms of the Transaction Documents and other documents referred to therein, under the caption "Plan of Distribution," insofar as they purport to describe the documents referred to therein, and under the caption "Certain Material U.S. Federal Income Tax Considerations" (subject to the limitations and qualifications set forth therein), insofar as they purport to describe the provisions of the laws and documents referred to therein, are accurate and complete in all material respects.

perturbation.original_text: The Remarketing Agents are undertaking to remarket Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 1, due 2018 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "First Tranche Series E Debt Securities") and Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 2, due 2045 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities"), whose terms will each be modified in the event of a Successful Remarketing (as defined below), as provided in the notice of remarketing from the Company, dated August 26, 2014 (the "Notice") pursuant to Section 3.3(a) of the Twenty-Second Supplemental Indenture (as defined below) and Section 5.2(a)(iv) of the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement (as defined below) (such securities, as so modified from and after a Successful Remarketing (whether or not such securities were remarketed by the Remarketing Agents), the "Securities").
perturbation.changed_text: The Remarketing Agents are undertaking to remarket Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 1, due 2018 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "First Tranche Series E Debt Instruments") and Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 2, due 2045 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities"), whose terms will each be modified in the event of a Successful Remarketing (as defined below), as provided in the notice of remarketing from the Company, dated August 26, 2014 (the "Notice") pursuant to Section 3.3(a) of the Twenty-Second Supplemental Indenture (as defined below) and Section 5.2(a)(iv) of the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement (as defined below) (such securities, as so modified from and after a Successful Remarketing (whether or not such securities were remarketed by the Remarketing Agents), the "Securities").
perturbation.explanation: Change from "First Tranche Series E Debt Securities" to "First Tranche Series E Debt Instruments". This is a key term as both 'Securities' and 'Instruments' are used for referring to the debt obligations, making it ambigious which definition to follow. This contradict the definition of the 'Securities' later on within the same paragraph.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The Company and the Remarketing Agents will enter into a Pricing Agreement, to be dated the Remarketing Date (as defined below) (the "Pricing Agreement"), which will set forth, inter alia, the final terms of the Remarketed Securities (as defined below) and the Remarketing Fee (as defined below). The Remarketing Agents are undertaking to remarket Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 1, due 2018 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "First Tranche Series E Debt Instruments") and Series E Senior Component Debentures, Tranche 2, due 2045 (principal amount $1,000 per Series E Senior Component Debenture) (the "Second Tranche Series E Debt Securities"), whose terms will each be modified in the event of a Successful Remarketing (as defined below), as provided in the notice of remarketing from the Company, dated August 26, 2014 (the "Notice") pursuant to Section 3.3(a) of the Twenty-Second Supplemental Indenture (as defined below) and Section 5.2(a)(iv) of the Stock Purchase Contract Agreement (as defined below) (such securities, as so modified from and after a Successful Remarketing (whether or not such securities were remarketed by the Remarketing Agents), the "Securities").

perturbation.original_text: The Company hereby appoints Deutsche Bank as the initial Remarketing Agent, and Deutsche 3 Bank hereby accepts appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities on behalf of the holders thereof, (ii) establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) performing such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with and pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company hereby appoints Deutsche Bank as the initial Reselling Agent, and Deutsche 3 Bank hereby accepts appointment as Remarketing Agent, for the purpose of (i) Remarketing the Remarketed Securities on behalf of the holders thereof, (ii) establishing the Reset Rates (as defined below) for the Securities in connection with the Remarketing and (iii) performing such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with and pursuant to the Remarketing Procedures.
perturbation.explanation: Change from "Remarketing Agent" to "Reselling Agent". This creates confusion as it is unclear if Deutsche Bank are the Remarketing Agents, the Reselling Agents or if these refer to the same thing. This contradict the well defined definition of the Remarketing Agents earlier on in the text and creates ambiguity, as both Agents are refered throughout the text.
perturbation.contradicted_text: (b) The Remarketing Agents agree (i) to use commercially reasonable efforts to remarket the Remarketed Securities tendered or deemed tendered to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing, (ii) to establish the Reset Rates in accordance with the Remarketing Procedures and to notify the Company, the Trustee and the Stock Purchase Contract Agent promptly of the Reset Rates and (iii) to carry out such other duties as are assigned to the Remarketing Agents in the Remarketing Procedures, all in accordance with the provisions of the Remarketing Procedures.
